context.item: You will analyze various types of documents to extract all text content while maintaining the natural reading order and flow of the document.
This task is crucial for preserving the original structure and intent of the document, ensuring that extracted text can be understood in its proper context.
Your structured output will be used for PDF accessibility tagging (PDF/UA compliance), enabling screen readers to present content in the correct order.
Each element you extract will be assigned a unique ID that allows joining with bounding box data from a separate extraction process.
Pay close attention to the layout of the page, including columns, sidebars, footnotes, and any non-standard text arrangements.
Your extraction should cover all textual elements, including headers, body text, captions, footnotes, and any other text present on the page.
Heading hierarchy (h1, h2, h3, h4) is critical for accessibility - screen reader users navigate documents by jumping between headings.
Be prepared to handle documents with multiple languages, different writing systems, and varying text directions.
When extracting text, refer to the definitions provided in the XML tags.
Use the format specifications in the XML tags to structure your responses.
If you're unsure about the correct reading order or encounter complex layouts, refer to the guidance in the XML tags.
